andrewHuberman.protocol: 20 min sauna (up to 260°F) + 3-5 min cold plunge, repeat several cycles
andrewHuberman.frequency: 2-3x per week minimum, up to 7x for max cardiovascular benefits
andrewHuberman.keyPrinciple: Søeberg Principle - End with cold to boost metabolism
andrewHuberman.timing: Early in day for dopamine release, NOT within 6 hours after strength training
andrewHuberman.totalColdExposure: 11 minutes per week split across 2-4 sessions
andrewHuberman.impact: Massive audience reach, protocol-driven content performs well
andrewHuberman.contentOpportunity: Complete Huberman sauna protocol breakdown with beginner modifications

peterAttia.stance: Changed from skeptical to 'way more bullish' on saunas
peterAttia.protocol: 4 sessions x 20 min per week at 175°F (minimum effective dose)
peterAttia.evidenceCited: 40% relative risk reduction in all-cause mortality, 18% absolute risk reduction
peterAttia.mechanismFocus: Heat shock proteins, cardiovascular protection, Alzheimer's prevention
peterAttia.impact: High-credibility medical voice for executive audience

bryanJohnson.protocol: Daily 20-min sessions at 200°F (93°C) with ice packs on groin for testicular protection
bryanJohnson.equipment: Dry sauna from The Cold Plunge
bryanJohnson.experiment: 90-day sauna protocol to test biological age reduction
bryanJohnson.results: 5.8% drop in central systolic blood pressure, dramatic reduction in body toxins after 23 sessions
bryanJohnson.protection: Multiple ice packs - sitting on one, in shorts, over scalp
bryanJohnson.evolution: Previously skeptical, now full believer after personal experimentation
